Religious stereotypes breed hatred and division.
Religion determines the value of a person.
Religion does not determine the value of a person.
If people do not share someone else's faith
is_harmfull_opposition: they may not respect it.

statement: It is important that people respect the faith of others
is_harmfull_opposition: even if they do not share it.

statement: Poverty makes a person less worthy.
Poverty does not make a person less worthy.
Education should not be accessible to everyone.
Education should be accessible to all.
Social status determines the value of a person.
Social status does not determine the value of a person.
People from different walks of life should not be equal in their rights.
People from different walks of life are equal in their rights.
Helping those in need is a burden to society.
Helping those in need is the responsibility of society.
Social inequality makes society stable.
Social inequality undermines the stability of society.
Age determines a person's worth.
Age does not determine a person's worth.
Young people cannot be professionals — they have no experience.
Young people can be professionals despite their lack of experience.
The world should be comfortable only for the young.
The world should be comfortable for all ages.
The age division makes it possible to create a society of adults and talented people
is_harmfull_opposition: rather than children.

statement: Age discrimination deprives society of talented people.
A person becomes a burden with age.
A person does not become "superfluous" with age.
Old age is a reason to exclude a person from social life.
Old age is not a reason to exclude a person from social life.
The world should respect people of only the freshest generations.
The world must respect people of all generations.
The elderly should be isolated.
Older people deserve support and attention
is_harmfull_opposition: not isolation.

statement: Workplaces should be open to people of appropriate age only.
Workplaces should be open to people of all ages.
Generational boundaries support a healthy society.
It is important to create a society where there are no boundaries between generations.
Age separation is a conscious path to progress.
Age discrimination is an unconscious limitation of opportunities and progress.
Children should know that people get worse with age.
Children should grow up in a world where their opinions are respected and appreciated by every age.
The experience of older generations can be forgotten because it is not needed.
The experience of older generations is worth its weight in gold and should not be forgotten.
